intro: Guenthera repanda var. africana, commonly known as the African guenthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
